title: Game of Thrones Social Network Data — game_of_thrones_network
text: data originally compiled . Beveridge J. Shan, "Network Thrones", Math Horizons Magazine , Vol. 23, . 4 (2016), pp. 18-22. Game Thrones data lends well basic social network analysis lot characters (yet many characters) , authors claim, characters "scattered geographically enmeshed social circles," various noble houses. unacquainted GOT, bit background info (via Beveridge Shan) might helpful understanding social network: "narrative starts time peace, houses unified rule King Robert Baratheon, holds Iron Throne...[King Robert dies heck breaks loose.] Driven cause circumstance, characters many noble families launch arduous intertwined journeys. Among houses honorable Stark family (Eddard, Catelyn, Robb, Sansa, Arya, Bran, Jon Snow), pompous Lannisters (Tywin, Jaime, Cersei, Tyrion, Joffrey), slighted Baratheons (led Robert’s brother Stannis) exiled Daenerys, last powerful House Targaryen." still like know source novel, might also check Wikipedia page cheeky 8-minute beginner's guide HBO show (warning: curse words aplenty).

text: Shortly Ezra Pound got involved *New Freewoman*, magazine evolved *Egoist*, becoming one important modernist magazines, published novels James Joyce Wyndham Lewis well  poetry criticism Ezra Pound T. S. Eliot. Notable authors published *Freewoman* included dataset: Rebecca West, Muriel Ciolkowska, Dora Marsden ("Ed. 'Freewoman'"), . Notable authors published *New Freewoman* included dataset: Rebecca West, Ezra Pound, Richard Aldington, Dora Marsden, . Notable authors published *Egoist* included dataset : Amy Lowell, William Carlos Williams, Marianne Moore, Richard Aldington, Muriel Ciolkowska, Ezra Pound, Dora Marsen, T.S. Eliot, Wyndham Lewis, . information, see Modernist Journals Project *Freewoman*, *New Freewoman*, http://modjourn.org/render.php?view=mjp_object&id=EgoistCollection.
